20101215140804.000|20101215140809.000|TR0|
20101215140809.000|20101215140814.000|TR0|If found guilty, hell stay

20101215140829.000|20101215140834.000|TR0|The 47-year-old made his fortune

20101215140837.333|20101215140840.667|TR0|the privatisation of state

20101215140849.000|20101215140854.000|TR0|
20101215140854.000|20101215140857.333|TR0|A three-person space crew are
20101215140857.333|20101215140900.667|TR0|making last preparations for a
20101215140900.667|20101215140904.000|TR0|five-month voyage into orbit
20101215140904.000|20101215140909.000|TR0|later today. The Soyuz rocket is
20101215140909.000|20101215140914.000|TR0|set to blast off to the
20101215140914.000|20101215140917.333|TR0|International Space Station with
20101215140917.333|20101215140920.667|TR0|its new group of explorers- a
20101215140920.667|20101215140924.000|TR0|Russian, American and Italian.
20101215140924.000|20101215140929.000|TR0|RT's Peter Oliver met them ahead
20101215140929.000|20101215140934.000|TR0|of the mission to discover more
20101215140934.000|20101215140937.333|TR0|of their personal side,
20101215140937.333|20101215140940.667|TR0|including one love story...
20101215140940.667|20101215140944.000|TR0|
20101215140944.000|20101215140949.000|TR0|When it comes to space travel,
20101215140949.000|20101215140954.000|TR0|clinical accuracy and pinpoint
20101215140954.000|20101215140957.333|TR0|engineering are the norm. But
20101215140957.333|20101215141000.667|TR0|these arent Sashas main
20101215141000.667|20101215141004.000|TR0|concerns. Shes the wife of
20101215141004.000|20101215141009.000|TR0|European Space Agency astronaut
20101215141009.000|20101215141014.000|TR0|Paulo Nespoli - and nervously
20101215141014.000|20101215141017.333|TR0|watches the Soyuz rocket that
20101215141017.333|20101215141020.667|TR0|her husbands safety depends on.
20101215141020.667|20101215141024.000|TR0|A family with space exploration
20101215141024.000|20101215141029.000|TR0|running through their veins, the
20101215141029.000|20101215141034.000|TR0|couple met while Paulo was
20101215141034.000|20101215141037.333|TR0|training near Moscow. Sasha was
20101215141037.333|20101215141040.667|TR0|a nurse at the space centre, and
20101215141040.667|20101215141044.000|TR0|her father is a Cosmonaut
20101215141044.000|20101215141049.000|TR0|instructor. Paulo married his
20101215141049.000|20101215141054.000|TR0|Russian bride while she was
20101215141054.000|20101215141057.333|TR0|visiting him in Houston. A spur
20101215141057.333|20101215141100.667|TR0|of the moment decision after the
20101215141100.667|20101215141104.000|TR0|couple realised they couldnt
20101215141104.000|20101215141109.000|TR0|stand being apart from one
20101215141109.000|20101215141114.000|TR0|another. The Italian will spend
20101215141114.000|20101215141117.333|TR0|the next six months on board the
20101215141117.333|20101215141120.667|TR0|ISS. But Paulo will be able to
20101215141120.667|20101215141124.000|TR0|stay in touch with Sasha and
20101215141124.000|20101215141129.000|TR0|their young daughter - through
20101215141129.000|20101215141134.000|TR0|phone calls and video links.
20101215141134.000|20101215141137.333|TR0|Standing at one metre
20101215141137.333|20101215141140.667|TR0|ninety-two, Nespoli will be the
20101215141140.667|20101215141144.000|TR0|tallest man ever to fly in a
20101215141144.000|20101215141149.000|TR0|Soyuz rocket. So tall in fact,
20101215141149.000|20101215141154.000|TR0|that a special seat had to be
20101215141154.000|20101215141157.333|TR0|made for him. The Mission
20101215141157.333|20101215141200.667|TR0|Commander is Cosmonaut Dmitry
20101215141200.667|20101215141204.000|TR0|Kondratyev. It will be this
20101215141204.000|20101215141209.000|TR0|Russians first journey into
20101215141209.000|20101215141214.000|TR0|space. A very serious and
20101215141214.000|20101215141217.333|TR0|focused individual, he plans to
20101215141217.333|20101215141220.667|TR0|use any down time on board the
20101215141220.667|20101215141224.000|TR0|ISS to train for his black-belt
20101215141224.000|20101215141229.000|TR0|in karate. Not an easy task
20101215141229.000|20101215141234.000|TR0|without gravitys help. NASAs
20101215141234.000|20101215141239.000|TR0|Catherine Coleman makes up the
20101215141239.000|20101215141244.000|TR0|crew. This will be her third
20101215141244.000|20101215141247.333|TR0|trip into space; and this time,
20101215141247.333|20101215141250.667|TR0|she will be bringing along a
20101215141250.667|20101215141254.000|TR0|passenger as a reminder of
20101215141254.000|20101215141259.000|TR0|home... her sons cuddly tiger.
20101215141259.000|20101215141304.000|TR0|Taking good luck tokens into
20101215141304.000|20101215141307.333|TR0|orbit is one of many traditions
20101215141307.333|20101215141310.667|TR0|associated with launches from
20101215141310.667|20101215141314.000|TR0|Baikonur. Strange that even in
20101215141314.000|20101215141319.000|TR0|the most high-tech of
20101215141319.000|20101215141324.000|TR0|environments, that the human
20101215141324.000|20101215141327.333|TR0|belief in fate plays such a
20101215141327.333|20101215141330.667|TR0|major part. STAND UP - Moving at
20101215141330.667|20101215141334.000|TR0|a snails pace so as not to do
20101215141334.000|20101215141339.000|TR0|any damage to the Spacecraft,
20101215141339.000|20101215141344.000|TR0|the fully-constructed Rocket
20101215141344.000|20101215141347.333|TR0|makes its way to the launch site
20101215141347.333|20101215141350.667|TR0|at Baikonur. Even here there are
20101215141350.667|20101215141354.000|TR0|superstitions. The placing of
20101215141354.000|20101215141359.000|TR0|coins on the track in front of
20101215141359.000|20101215141404.000|TR0|the train is supposed to bring
20101215141404.000|20101215141407.333|TR0|good luck. On the launch pad and
20101215141407.333|20101215141410.667|TR0|ready to go, the Soyuz TMA 20
20101215141410.667|20101215141414.000|TR0|rocket now waits for its crew.
20101215141414.000|20101215141419.000|TR0|Peter Oliver RT, Baikonur in
20101215141419.000|20101215141424.000|TR0|Kazakhstan.
20101215141424.000|20101215141427.333|TR0|
20101215141427.333|20101215141430.667|TR0|People fly into orbit and back
20101215141430.667|20101215141434.000|TR0|every few months now... So RT
20101215141434.000|20101215141439.000|TR0|looks at how it all began. Watch
20101215141439.000|20101215141444.000|TR0|our special report about the
20101215141444.000|20101215141447.333|TR0|first man in space, Yury Gagarin
20101215141447.333|20101215141450.667|TR0|-- in just over 10 minutes time.
20101215141450.667|20101215141454.000|TR0|
20101215141454.000|20101215141459.000|TR0|Russia is hosting separate talks
20101215141459.000|20101215141504.000|TR0|with North and South Korean
20101215141504.000|20101215141507.333|TR0|representatives on resuming the
20101215141507.333|20101215141510.667|TR0|six-party negotiations over
20101215141510.667|20101215141514.000|TR0|tensions on the Korean peninsula.
20101215141514.000|20101215141519.000|TR0|
20101215141519.000|20101215141524.000|TR0|Moscow is one of the most vocal
20101215141524.000|20101215141527.333|TR0|advocates for a peaceful
20101215141527.333|20101215141530.667|TR0|solution to the current crisis.
20101215141530.667|20101215141534.000|TR0|On Tuesday foreign minister
20101215141534.000|20101215141539.000|TR0|Sergey Lavrov and his North
20101215141539.000|20101215141544.000|TR0|Korean counterpart agreed that
20101215141544.000|20101215141547.333|TR0|the turmoil must be resolved
20101215141547.333|20101215141550.667|TR0|through diplomatic means only.
20101215141550.667|20101215141554.000|TR0|Pyongyang has also welcomed
20101215141554.000|20101215141559.000|TR0|China's proposal to hold a
20101215141559.000|20101215141604.000|TR0|meeting between the heads of
20101215141604.000|20101215141607.333|TR0|delegation to the six-party
20101215141607.333|20101215141610.667|TR0|talks. Leonid Petrov - a
20101215141610.667|20101215141614.000|TR0|lecturer in Korean Studies from
20101215141614.000|20101215141619.000|TR0|the University of Sydney - says
20101215141619.000|20101215141624.000|TR0|the threat is not coming from
20101215141624.000|20101215141627.333|TR0|the North itself, but from
20101215141627.333|20101215141630.667|TR0|isolation imposed by foreign
20101215141630.667|20101215141634.000|TR0|countries.
20101215141634.000|20101215141639.000|TR0|
20101215141639.000|20101215141644.000|TR0|Leonid Petrov - a lecturer of
20101215141644.000|20101215141647.333|TR0|Korean Studies from the
20101215141647.333|20101215141650.667|TR0|University of Sydney.
20101215141650.667|20101215141654.000|TR0|
20101215141654.000|20101215141659.000|TR0|From trillion-dollar conflicts
20101215141659.000|20101215141704.000|TR0|to a squandered economy, many
20101215141704.000|20101215141707.333|TR0|believe the U.S. is going
20101215141707.333|20101215141710.667|TR0|through its darkest time yet.
20101215141710.667|20101215141714.000|TR0|The federal reserve says slow
20101215141714.000|20101215141719.000|TR0|economic growth is to blame for
20101215141719.000|20101215141724.000|TR0|ongoing record-high jobless
20101215141724.000|20101215141727.333|TR0|figures. But, as KRISTIN FRAZAO
20101215141727.333|20101215141730.667|TR0|reports, the numbers may in fact
20101215141730.667|20101215141734.000|TR0|be masking an even harsher
20101215141734.000|20101215141739.000|TR0|reality...
20101215141739.000|20101215141744.000|TR0|
20101215141744.000|20101215141747.333|TR0|THE NUMBERS, BY ANY STRETCH, ARE
20101215141747.333|20101215141750.667|TR0|STAGGERING. "We just got in the
20101215141750.667|20101215141754.000|TR0|government's monthly jobs report
20101215141754.000|20101215141759.000|TR0|and it really was a
20101215141759.000|20101215141804.000|TR0|disappointment on all counts"
20101215141804.000|20101215141807.333|TR0|"Hope for some holiday cheer at
20101215141807.333|20101215141810.667|TR0|the end of this long tough year
20101215141810.667|20101215141814.000|TR0|but instead the unemployment
20101215141814.000|20101215141819.000|TR0|rate rose to 9.8%." 9.8 percent
20101215141819.000|20101215141824.000|TR0|is the unemployment rate.
20101215141824.000|20101215141827.333|TR0|Average hourly earnings - no
20101215141827.333|20101215141830.667|TR0|change BY SOME ESTIMATES, THAT
20101215141830.667|20101215141834.000|TR0|RATE, WHICH TRANSLATES TO
20101215141834.000|20101215141839.000|TR0|FIFTEEN MILLION PEOPLE.. IS
20101215141839.000|20101215141844.000|TR0|ACTUALLY CLOSER TO 20
20101215141844.000|20101215141849.000|TR0|PERCENT.... OR 30 MILLION PEOPLE
